s.text: MALS earlier this month announced it expects to lose $200,000 in 2003 and beyond, largely due to a drop in the number of poor people it serves in four counties, according to the latest Census.

We have been working very hard to call the legal community's and the public's attention to our funding crisis and its impact on MALS's efforts to secure equal access to justice for our community's poor and elderly residents."
MALS earlier this month announced it expects to lose $200,000 in 2003 and beyond, largely due to a drop in the number of poor people it serves in four counties, according to the latest Census.

We have been working very hard to call the legal community's and the public's attention to our funding crisis and its impact on MALS's efforts to secure equal access to justice for our community's poor and elderly residents."

Grants Help Optimize Nonprofits' Ability to Aid Community Programs

Memphis Area Legal Services and six other nonprofit groups will share more than $124,000 to help them operate, analyze and plan for growth and survival, thanks to a new focus by the Community Foundation of Greater Memphis.
